repnme.cdata!:
Guyana - Sugar Industry Restructuring and
            Privatization Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for. The Sugar Industry Restructuring and
            Privatization Project in Guyana. In 1990, the Bank's
            Country Assistance Strategy for Guyana emphasized the need
            for reducing severe fiscal and external imbalances and
            encouraging private sector development. The project sought
            to maintain sugar production at its present level, with the
            unstated goal of restoring Guyana's ability to fill its
            export quota with the European Union. It also sought to
            ensure the technical and financial viability of the industry
            through restructuring and privatization of Guyana Sugar
            Company (GUYSUCO). The project's components consisted
            of (a) a two-year capital investment program and (b)
            technical assistance to prepare GUYSUCO for privatization.
            The project outcome was unsatisfactory. Both preparation
            assistance and International Development Association (IDA)
            appraisal were rated deficient. Borrower’s performance was
            very sound. The key lessons to be learned from the project
            are as follows: (a) the justification for committing scarce
            IDA resources to privatization projects needs to be examined
            closely; (b) IDA efforts to support privatization should
            more appropriately be part of an Adjustment and Policy
            Reform Operation with TA instead of an investment project;
            (c) bringing publicly-owned enterprises under private
            management may lead to large efficiency gains; and (d) a
            privatization strategy needs to be properly sequenced.

18157383.theme: State-owned enterprise restructuring and privatization,Regulation and competition policy

repnme.cdata!:
Guyana - Sugar Industry Restructuring and
            Privatization Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Guyana's economy is mainly based on
            the production of bauxite, sugar and rice. Improving the
            efficiency of the sugar industry is vital to Guyana's
            economy. The production of sugar was reduced, initially
            because of world prices. Under Government ownership the
            output has continued to drop. The purpose of this Sugar
            Industry Restructuring and Privatization Project is to help
            secure the Guyana Sugar Corporation Limited's (GUYSUCO)
            present level of production and financial viability, and to
            ensure the long-term technical and financial viability of
            the sugar industry by helping the Government restructure and
            privatize GUYSUCO. The project comprises two components:
            capital investment in priority operating factory equipment
            and machinery to stabilize sugar production at the present
            rate; and technical assistance in the form of financial
            advisory and management services.
